channel.title: Is there a way to encrypt the cache?
channel.description: I don't want people being able to change things around, is there a way to encrypt the cache?

item.title: Is there a way to encrypt the cache?
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

cardguydude:

Could you use some kind of encryption feature like people use obfuscation for java files?

You could, but you would still need a way to decrypt the data in the cache, and that would have to be built into the client, so they would still be able to make changes.

Read full topic
item.source: Is there a way to encrypt the cache?

item.title: Is there a way to encrypt the cache?
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

It’s compressed already. There’s nothing you can really do to prevent people from editing the cache.

Read full topic
item.source: Is there a way to encrypt the cache?

item.title: Is there a way to encrypt the cache?
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

cardguydude:

I don’t want people being able to change things around, is there a way to encrypt the cache?

yes, but if someone really wants to change the contents of the cache they will. (you’d need the decryption scheme in the client)

Read full topic
item.source: Is there a way to encrypt the cache?

item.title: Is there a way to encrypt the cache?
item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

That wouldnt do much would just change how they see things tbh…

And if you can somehow conert everything so it reads from different kind of files or something… well that would be too much work thats not worthit…

item.title: Is there a way to encrypt the cache?
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

They won’t be able to change anything if you have everything packed & not pre-loaded.

And they couldn’t do much with the client anyways.

Read full topic
